comment: Classes are simple. Do pre-lab simulated assignments (McGraw-Hill), read the lab manual, attend the class, and follow instructions. After it, you have a lab worksheet to complete with the data; they're straightforward. She's a great teacher. She's considerate regarding assignments, knowledgeable about the labs, and open to questions.

Her homework is easy. There are a few easy, random in-class activities (for attendance). The tests are moderately easy; however, there are no study guides, so the teacher's recommended study method is to study the notes, slides, in-class activities, and the textbook for added info on subjects. Her lectures are a bit non-specific; she's kind though.

as a bio major i'm a bit biased but traud was a great professor. she gave so many opportunities to succeed & in my opinion it was practically impossible to fail her class with how much she cushions grades. her tests were identical or similar to the SI kahoots/jeopardies. i studied for literally 1 day before each test. she's so easy and made bio fun

I had Professor Traud for BIO 3340L and she was awesome! She explained the microbiology topics and techniques extremely well and set us up for success with the pre lab work. Everything we did led up to the unknown microbe report which ended up not being bad because of all the work we did throughout the semester. TAKE HER! 10/10 recommend.

Her grade book is heavily cushioned and you will do a wonderful job even if you are not the best test taker. Easy to talk to. Just make sure to do all homework and in-class group activities to ensure you get a good grade and have the test cushioning. Lovely woman, pretty good lecturer. I loved si sessions for help and friends.

Sweet lady. built her grade book so we would have plenty of cushion grades. Alwys wanted to help her students in any way. Fast email responses. Lots of extra credit opportunities. You might have to read the book and attend si sessions only bc I feel as though she does read straight from the powerpoint, but she will add some explaining; it depends.

Very happy with Professor Traud. She is an excellent lecturer and an amazing grader. The homeworks, in class activities, and extra credit (I think 3 were available) you will be able to cushion your grade. As someone who is not an amazing test taker and the highest test grade I got was a C, I ended with an A overall! She is a fun, outgoing professor

Bio 1107 is a difficult course, especially since I took it during the summer. Please pick a different professor cause I would've passed with an A but she wanted to be picky and drop an assignment I did GOOD on. After some emailing, she told me to retake the class after telling her I needed an A for my major... please pick someone else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Traud is amazing! She is very friendly and helpful. So much extra credit for this class, and her gradebook was goated! I would definitely recommend you take her! Be prepared to study, though. I took AP Bio in high school, so I have prior experience, but the class is definitely doable, and you should certainly pass.

great professor! she caring and interactive. takes attendance & assigns in-class activities that you can do with people sitting near you. you 100% have to read the textbook and complete the pearson assignments for credit. 17 chapter quizzes on lockdown, 5 exams in person on paper, and several extra credit opportunities. jeopardy before exams too!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Good professor! Biology 1107 is a difficult course to pass without studying, so cross-reference her lectures and textbooks. You can fail 2 exams out of 5 (I took this class during the summer) and still manage to get an A or B. All of her quizzes and exams are webcam and lockdown browser.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: It's important to listen to her lectures and to cross reference with the textbook so you'll be able to pass the class. She is caring. Her tests are pretty average, if you took any AP classes they're in a similar format as that. She does have office hours but they are limited, however, she is willing to make an appointment if you email her.

Her class is lecture heavy and there's a lot of exams, but the way she teaches the material makes it easy to learn. As long as you study the powerpoints, you'll be fine. She also gives study guides for exams. She's a lenient grader and will take questions out of exams if lots of people got it wrong. Take her if you can!

Professor Traud's lectures were extremely interesting. She gave A TONNN of extra credit. Homework and quizzes were worth just as much as all of the tests. You could fail 2 out of the 7or 8 tests and still wind up with an A as long as you do well on the other exams. Do whatever you absolutely can to take this professor she is amazing!!!

Professor Traud gives you every opportunity to succeed in her class. With the countless extra credit opportunities and study guides that are formatted like the exams, you won't have a hard time in her class. As long as you do the homework and study, you'll be fine. She made learning Biology really fun!

She was a nice professor and she's so understanding if you have things outside of school. The good thing is she gives extra credit but she only reads PowerPoint slides which is a no for me if I would've known that I probably won't have taken the class. Her hw is online but it's nothing we learn in class so read the book.
VERY nice lady and she really cares about her students. if you need help on a lab she will help you out. SHe also recommends videos for you to understand better.

She's a nice professor but her class made me so confused. She does not explain the slides and the homework she assigns is sometimes not even what we covered in class. If you're a visual learner like me I wouldn't take this class it is lecture heavy.
Prof. Traud is a nice lady, but not the best bio professor I've had. Her powerpoints are confusing if you're not there to listen to her lecture, so definitely show up to every class.
she cares for her students but make sure to study for the exams

She is a great lab teacher. If you get involved in the class it's very fun and easy. Usually, get out 1 to almost 2 hrs early. There's always a Quizlet for the pre-lab quizzes, which go up to 110% to pad your grade. Lab posters are the most challenging part of the semester but even those aren't that difficult. I would definitely take her again.

This professor really wants you to succeed but a lot of the material is given to you in a quick form and expected to retain after hearing it once. Bc of that - you-ll have to do a lot of outside studying. She is readily available to answer ANYTHING and will TOTALLY work with you - but it is not an easy class. a lot of information jammed.

I took the summer lecture course and the 1107 lab section with her and she was always super nice. While with the lab you work in partners she's very attentive to concerns about lab partners not pulling weight. she never based the tests or quizzes off anything she didn't explicitly assign or say in class.

Professor Traud is a tough grader, but answers all questions and gives lots of extra credit. I suggest reading every chapter and watching the extra videos she posts for a better understanding of the material. Many group activities that are worth points, so don't skip class. Biology is just a lot to learn, but I better understand how the world works
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very approachable/kind person and always open to chat if you need help, but, during class, she just reads off of the ppt and thinks we understand everything she's saying. Lots of group work, lots of Pearson work, weekly quizzes, lecture heavy, test heavy. Had to put a lot of time and effort into this class, most time consuming class I've had.
Decent prof, definitely a bit of the hippy vegan type and made sure everyone knew it. Explains things like you are a toddler, and the homework is unrelated to the classwork and quizzes.

Attendance is mandatory and she assigns a lot of group work. Kari provides an unclear study guide that either briefly covers a wide variety of topics, tells you to refer to the book or slides, or simply says know how this works. Be prepared to put in a lot of effort into this class, I do not recommend taking this if you are not a biology major.

Be ready to do a lot of work in Trauds class. She gives a lot more info than necessary which can make studying for tests very difficult. Her teaching style isnt much teaching, she just reads off of the PowerPoint every class and adds videos off the internet. Could do the class online if attendance wasnt a grade. Shes pretty annoying but not bad

Prof Traud is such a great Professor, she is TRULY so understanding and if you study, you will pass, She TELLS YOU WHAT WILL be on the test thru her lecture If you show up to class, understand the ppts (test are just like the ppt) and study you will pass her class. She gives so much extra credit i don't understand how someone could fail. TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a cool teacher, but she makes her tests very difficult ngl. If this is your only option you could take her, but she definitely makes the class harder then it needs to be. The quizzes homework and classwork are all 20 percent and the tests are 30 percent. So you can do bad on the tests and still get an A in the class if you do everything else
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Professor Traud is one of the most caring people I have every met. Her lectures were amazing, since she would ask if everyone had an understanding of the topic. She did give a lot of homework, but test werent too hard. Offers office hours and would explain the topic as clear as water to you. I do recommend her class!

I LOVE professor Traud!! She makes it easy to understand and really cares to get to know all of her students. There is a pre lab quiz every week which is the most stressful part because the only grades are the 9 quizzes and the final. Study hard before the quizzes and you will do fine. It is the same for all labs so take her for the best experience

Exams and quizzes hold high % over the final grade but participation, Homework, classwork, ETC. really help to even out the final grade. Attendance also is a % of the final grade and all most quizzes/classwork is done in person by the end of period. She is super understanding if you explain yourself and she really nice. Overall great professor.
